page.title: 01CODMORE HILL AND NORTH HEATH
page.content: At the southern end of this farming area, Codmore Hill runs east to west at a height of about 200 feet above sea level. It continues eastward to Borough Farm and Beedings where the ridge is over 300 feet high. To the south of the hill are the gallops of a racehorse owner, from which there is a wide panaromic view over farmlands to the South Downs. To the north the view centres on the Toat Monument and its adjacent orchards. In the extreme north west of the block runs the river Arun and to the east of the river, the overgrown bed of the former Wey and Arun Canal. From south west to north east runs the main A29 Chichester to London road; with the Portsmouth to London railway roughly parallel to its east.
